creator.name: Algemene Rekenkamer - Comptabel Beheer
creator.his_func: The Accountant's supervision was a section of the General Auditor's Office of the Netherlands, which is responsible for overseeing the finances of the government. The expenditure of the Ministry of Colonies included the expenses that were made in the Netherlands. When slavery was abolished in the West Indies (1 July 1863), slave owners lost their employees. To be eligible for compensation by the Dutch state, owners were required to answer a list of questions, a so-called 'borderel van aangifte'. These lists give information on the number of slaves per owner, age, type of work, etc. An account of the payments are preserved in the archives of the Accountant's supervision (1863-1868).
